title.narrative: Rusitu SS Dairy Production and Marketing Expansion Project

description.narrative: Sector: Agriculture. Dairy.Beneficiaries: 210, of which 30 are women.Project Description: The project will assess the current herd size and dispose of nonproductive cows, replacing them with pure breed dairy cows. Farmers will increase production, processing and preservation of forage crops that are nutritionally balanced and adequate to cover animal feeding both in and out of season. USADF funds will be used to procure dairy farm equipment that will increase efficiency in production and processing, such as a tractor and associated implements ie disc harrow, planter, trailer with side beds, silage cutter. The project will purchase 50 pure bred dairy cows through a cattle revolving loan and provide for forage inputs in a stock feed revolving loan will boost production. The project will fund trainings in groups on leadership issues, herd management, dairy business management including strategies to reduce costs at the farm level. .

participating-org.narrative: Rusitu United Dairy Farmers Co-op Ltd

description.narrative: Sector: Irrigated agriculture.Beneficiaries: 357 producers and 745 employees .Description: The project will improve access to inputs through revolving loan fund and strengthened access to bank loans to enable farmers to increase acreage and yields; establish solar-powered boreholes to increase cropping cycles and save on energy costs and provide a solar powered cold-room to store perishable produce and reduce post-harvest losses of fresh groundnuts and tomatoes. mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I St. NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005

description.narrative: Grassroots entities in Zimbabwe are engaged in a diverse range of activities that hold significant potential for benefiting their communities. Viewed in the aggregate, these activities can play a critical role in fostering sustained economic and social development of the country. However, for the most part grassroots entities are constrained in exploiting these opportunities and participating actively in the social and economic development of their countries by lack of access to financial, technical, and other resources. ..The United States African Development Foundation (USADF) provides such entities direct financial support in the form of grants to:..carry out activities at the local level designed to enlarge opportunities for community development;.expand their participation in development processes; and.establish and promote indigenous development institutions that can respond to the requirements of the poor...The shortage of community development institutions that can provide in-country expertise to support successful grassroots activities impedes these objectives. USADF has found that it can overcome this obstacle by helping local development institutions strengthen their capacity to support community-based and other activities that benefit the poor. To this end, USADF has established the Community Development Institutions Program ("Program"). Under this Program, USADF and a local development agency ("Partner") enter into a cooperative agreement that provides direct support to the Partner to: (a) build its capacity; and (b) provide support to grassroots entities. .

description.narrative: Sector: Agriculture. Food Crops - Potatoes., Beneficiaries: 87 smallholder farmers; of whom 40 are women., The Greenwood Potato Capacity Building Project will assist the Greenwood Farmers' Cooperative to establish sufficient business systems and strengthen internal controls; including corporate governance training, financial management and business management training. The USADF grant will help Greenwood to establish stronger business policies and procedures. Greenwood will also increase productivity through trainings in crop management, farm planning and management. Membership will be increased under the project through the provision of farmer training and increased working capital for inputs. USADF funds will be provided for technical assistance, training, production inputs, business plan development and administrative support.,

description.narrative: Zimbabwe s farmers deal with inconsistent sources of income and unpredictable harvests and prices. Kudais tackling this reality by getting women into the honey business. Local and national demand exceeds supply; the price on the market is comparatively stable; and start-up costs are relatively low. This start-up will expand after training members on beekeeping and proving the concept.

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I St. NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005

description.narrative: The project intends to increase revenues of HCOC through increased production and sales of chicken from current 22000 to 100,000 broilers per year by 2021. The project will establish more butchery at strategic points, in Murewa and elsewhere. The project will increase supplies of chicken to butcheries in the market.

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I St. NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005

description.narrative: Funds used to establish 17 communal organic gardens; provide working capital inputs; train farmers in sustainable farming skills.

mailing-address.narrative: 1400 I St. NW Suite 1000, Washington, DC 20005

description.narrative: Sector: Livestock - Dairy, Beneficiaries: 55 Rural small holder dairy farmers. , Rusitu United Dairy Co-operative is a membership owned group of smallholder dairy farmers in the Chipinge District of Eastern Zimbabwe. The project aims to increase members incomes through assistance of a cattle revolving loan fund. There are currently 55 members, of which 12 are women. USADF funds will assist Rusitu United Dairy Farmers Cooperative to: a) train staff and board members in good governance practices; b) purchase pure dairy cows; c) administration of artificial inseminations, and training of herd and fodder management, and basic dairy entrepreneurship; d) procure tillage and planting equipment; e) procurement of processing equipment; f) training on processing for the processors; g) undertake study tours.

description.narrative: The project funds will be used to train staff in good governance practices; purchase accounting software; train farmers in improved horticultural practices and the farming business; establish a bulking station for storage; develop accounting and human resource policy manuals; hire a full-time field officer to provide technical assistance to farmers; purchase a motorcycle and bicycles for provision of extension services; and purchase office equipment.
